item.text: King Solomon fell in love with many foreign women (besides Pharaoh’s daughter), including Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Sidonians, and Hittites.

They came from nations about which the Lord had warned the Israelites, “You must not establish friendly relations with them! If you do, they will surely shift your allegiance to their gods.” But Solomon was irresistibly attracted to them.
He had 700 royal wives and 300 concubines; his wives had a powerful influence over him.
When Solomon became old, his wives shifted his allegiance to other gods; he was not wholeheartedly devoted to the Lord his God, as his father David had been.

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="01980 0310">worshiped</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="06722" class="">Sidonian</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">goddess</st> <st data-num="06253" class="">Astarte</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="08251" class="">detestable</st> <st data-num="05984" class="">Ammonite</st> <st data-num="08251" class="">god</st> <st data-num="04445" class="">Milcom</st>.<n id="2" />
Solomon did evil in the Lord’s sight; he did not remain loyal to the Lord, as his father David had.

<st data-num="0227" class="">Furthermore</st>,<n id="1" /> on the <st data-num="02022 0834">hill</st> <st data-num="05921 06440">east of</st> <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st> a <st data-num="01116" class="">high place</st><n id="3" /> for the <st data-num="08251" class="">detestable</st> <st data-num="04124" class="">Moabite</st> <st data-num="08251" class="">god</st> <st data-num="03645" class="">Chemosh</st><n id="4" /> and for the <st data-num="08251" class="">detestable</st> <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonite</st> <st data-num="08251" class="">god</st> <st data-num="04445" class="">Milcom</st>.<n id="5" />
He built high places for all his foreign wives so they could burn incense and make sacrifices to their gods.
The Lord was angry with Solomon because he had shifted his allegiance away from the Lord, the God of Israel, who had appeared to him on two occasions
and had warned him about this very thing, so that he would not follow other gods. But he did not obey the Lord’s command.
So the Lord said to Solomon, “Because you insist on doing these things and have not kept the covenantal rules I gave you, I will surely tear the kingdom away from you and give it to your servant.

I will <st data-num="07167" class="">tear</st> it <st data-num="07167" class="">away</st> from your <st data-num="01121" class="">son’s</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> instead.
But I will not tear away the entire kingdom; I will leave your son one tribe for my servant David’s sake and for the sake of my chosen city Jerusalem.”
The Lord brought against Solomon an enemy, Hadad the Edomite, a descendant of the Edomite king.

<st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="04672 02580 05869">liked</st> <st data-num="01908" class="">Hadad</st> <st data-num="03966" class="">so well</st><n id="1" /> he <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> him his <st data-num="0269 0802">sister-in-law</st> (<st data-num="01377" class="">Queen</st> <st data-num="08472" class="">Tahpenes’</st> <st data-num="0269" class="">sister</st>) as a <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st>.<n id="2" />

So <st data-num="01908" class="">Hadad</st> <st data-num="0559 0413">asked</st> <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st>, “<st data-num="07971" class="">Give</st> me <st data-num="07971" class="">permission to leave</st><n id="2" /> so I can <st data-num="01980" class="">return</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> my <st data-num="0776" class="">homeland</st>.”
Pharaoh said to him, “What do you lack here that makes you want to go to your homeland?” Hadad replied, “Nothing, but please give me permission to leave.”
God also brought against Solomon another enemy, Rezon son of Eliada who had run away from his master, King Hadadezer of Zobah.

He <st data-num="06908 05921">gathered</st> some <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> and <st data-num="01961 08269">organized</st> a <st data-num="01416" class="">raiding band</st>.<n id="1" /> When <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> tried to <st data-num="02026" class="">kill</st> them,<n id="2" /> they <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> to <st data-num="01834" class="">Damascus</st>, where they <st data-num="03427" class="">settled down</st> and <st data-num="04427" class="">gained control</st> of the <st data-num="01834" class="">city</st>.
He was Israel’s enemy throughout Solomon’s reign and, like Hadad, caused trouble. He loathed Israel and ruled over Syria.
Jeroboam son of Nebat, one of Solomon’s servants, rebelled against the king. He was an Ephraimite from Zeredah whose mother was a widow named Zeruah.

<st data-num="02088" class="">This</st> is <st data-num="01697 0834">what</st> prompted him to <st data-num="07311 03027">rebel</st> against the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>:<n id="1" /> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st> a <st data-num="04407" class="">terrace</st>, and he <st data-num="05462" class="">closed up</st> a <st data-num="06556" class="">gap</st> in the wall of the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> of his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="0376 03379">Jeroboam</st> was a <st data-num="02428" class="">talented</st> <st data-num="01368" class="">man</st>;<n id="1" /> when <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="05288" class="">young man</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">was</st> an <st data-num="06213" class="">accomplished</st> <st data-num="04399" class="">worker</st>, he <st data-num="06485" class="">made</st> him the <st data-num="03605" class="">leader</st> of the <st data-num="05447" class="">work crew</st> from the <st data-num="01004" class="">tribe</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st>.

Then he told Jeroboam, “Take 10 pieces, for this is what the Lord God of Israel has said: ‘Look, I am about to tear the kingdom from Solomon’s hand and I will give 10 tribes to you.

He will <st data-num="01961" class="">retain</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="07626" class="">tribe</st>, <st data-num="04616" class="">for</st> my <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David’s</st> <st data-num="04616" class="">sake</st> and <st data-num="04616" class="">for the sake of</st> <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>, the <st data-num="05892 0834">city</st> I have <st data-num="0977" class="">chosen</st> out of <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="07626" class="">tribes</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.

Solomon tried to kill Jeroboam, but Jeroboam escaped to Egypt and found refuge with King Shishak of Egypt. He stayed in Egypt until Solomon died.
The rest of the events of Solomon’s reign, including all his accomplishments and his wise decisions, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of Solomon.

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="03117 0834 04427">ruled</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> from <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st><n id="1" /> for <st data-num="0705" class="">40</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st>.
